alert.note: Alert for Williams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 3:48PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Williams County through 430 PM EDT... At 348 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Edon, or 8 miles northeast of Butler, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Edgerton around 405 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Montpelier and Bryan. This includes Interstate 80 in Ohio between mile markers 11 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
